title: ICE when compiling a package

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The compiler panics.

I tried this code:
https://github.com/XavilPergis/birblike

I expected to see this happen: The program compiling or giving an error.

Instead, this happened: The program paniced

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.28.0-nightly (01cc982e9 2018-06-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 01cc982e936120acb0424e41de14e42ba2d88c6f
commit-date: 2018-06-24
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.28.0-nightly
LLVM version: 6.0
```
